topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Anneka Gupta, her roles (CPO at Rubrik, Stanford lecturer, board member), and previews episode themes like strategy, feedback, energy management, and navigating difficult colleagues.

topics.title: Having fun during hard times at work
topics.summary: Anneka shares a core mindset: deliberately finding ways to have fun even in difficult situations to avoid scarcity thinking and unlock better problem-solving, including a story about rapidly changing out her direct reports.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Enterprise Ready Conference and Command AI.

topics.title: Founder mode: working effectively with founders
topics.summary: They discuss Paul Graham’s 'founder mode' concept and Anneka explains how product leaders can leverage a founder’s unique power as a force-multiplier, while also navigating pet projects by clarifying underlying objectives and choosing which battles to fight.

topics.title: Founder mode as a product leader
topics.summary: Anneka describes 'founder-mode' leadership behaviors for product execs: go deep on business details, selectively intervene where it matters most, and bring teams along via early involvement, questions, and hypothesis-sharing rather than top-down rewrites.

topics.title: Becoming more strategic: definition and tactics
topics.summary: Anneka defines 'strategic' as (1) articulating a compelling, simple why and (2) championing hard, long-term change; she shares practical tactics like summarizing discussions, synthesizing viewpoints, and making ideas 'one click better.'

topics.title: Decision-making: be the historian of past choices
topics.summary: Anneka explains how learning a company’s decision history—what failed, why, and what baggage remains—improves current decision-making and helps leaders anticipate objections like 'we tried that before.'

topics.title: Decision-making: commit, learn, and iterate fast
topics.summary: She argues it’s more important to make a decision than chase perfect information: commit with a clear hypothesis, learn from real-world feedback, and build a culture that rewards learning over outcomes to reduce fear of being wrong.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message for Eppo (A/B testing and feature management).

topics.title: Navigating difficult personalities with curiosity and gratitude
topics.summary: Anneka shares how she handles high-ego or hard-to-work-with colleagues by understanding what drives them, aligning incentives, learning from their strengths, and reframing frustration into curiosity and gratitude; she also suggests asking others how to work with them effectively.

topics.title: Receiving hard feedback: feel it, then get curious
topics.summary: Anneka outlines a process for receiving tough feedback: allow the emotional reaction, avoid immediate defensiveness, investigate context with curiosity, and decide what to act on by anchoring to what the company needs most right now.
